law.catch_line: Minimum detention in custody when blood alcohol reading exceeds .15 percent.
law.text: Any person who is arrested for a violation of KRS 189A.010 and who, upon blood alcohol testing, shows a blood alcohol reading above .15 percent shall be detained in custody at least four (4) hours following his arrest.
law.history: Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 165, sec. 11, effective July 13, 1984.
